answers.answer: Hi,It will help to know when was the last time you got your sugar levels checked. Diabetes can cause peripheral neuropathy which can manifest as twitching in the muscles.As of now ALS does not seem to be a strong possibility as it is important to make sure your sugar levels are normal since you have a positive history of diabetes.Please get you levels done and keep us posted.

question: Hi how are you I was wondering if you could help me out a bit im 18 and i get started getting a pulsating twiching like feeling and I can see it move up and down the nerve in my left hand between my thumb and index finger. I was wondering what could be the cause and could it be high sugar levels as I was diagnosed as insulin resistant at 15 and kinda went off my diet in the past few months. Thnx I hope its not ALS cause that would be devastating .
title: twitching
